Everything

Off-CircuitViêt and Nam12:00 PM                Shot on 16mm, Trương Minh Quý's quietly expressive and sensual drama centred upon two young coal miners is a hypnotic excavation of the memories and legacies of a nation.

Eddington12:40 PM                Set in May of 2020, Ari Aster's latest film centres upon a stand-off between a small town sheriff (Joaquin Phoenix) and mayor (Pedro Pascal) which sparks a powder keg in the town of Eddington, New Mexico as neighbour is pitted against neighbour.

Sex2:20 PM                Two married men confront unexpected experiences that challenge their views on sexuality, identity, and gender — one through a same-sex encounter, the other through transformative dreams.

Off-CircuitUK PREMIERE Measures for a Funeral3:40 PM                Histories and fictions intertwine as Sofia Bohdanowicz concludes her Audrey Benac cycle with a captivating exploration of the life and work of Canadian violinist Kathleen Parlow.

Little Trouble Girls4:40 PM                The debut feature from Slovenian director Urška Djukić is a tender portrayal, sensuously shot and beautifully scored, of the sexual awakening of a young chorister.
Mother Vera6:30 PM                Haunted by a tumultuous past, Vera has spent 20 years in refuge at a Belarusian monastery. Guided by her love of horses, she sets out on a path of redemption.

Serge Daney and the Promise of CinemaCity of Pirates on 35mm6:30 PM                Blending folk legends, surrealist poetry, children’s adventure stories, and Hollywood horror movies, City of Pirates follows a nonlinear narrative about a sleepwalking virgin, a ten-year-old boy who claims to have raped and murdered his entire family, and the lone inhabitant of an island castle who shares his body with an imaginary sister.

In The Nguyen Kitchen 8:20 PM                First-time feature filmmaker Stéphane Ly-Cuong blends a heady cocktail of musical theatre, Vietnamese cuisine and second-generation tension to create a bitter-sweet musical comedy.
Sorry, Baby9:00 PM                Blending heartache, humour and healing, Sorry, Baby is a bitingly-funny debut by director and actor Eva Victor.

In The Nguyen Kitchen 12:00 PM                First-time feature filmmaker Stéphane Ly-Cuong blends a heady cocktail of musical theatre, Vietnamese cuisine and second-generation tension to create a bitter-sweet musical comedy.

Put Your Soul on Your Hand and Walk4:20 PM                A haunting testament to the resilience of daily life under siege in Gaza. Captured through a filmmaker's video calls with Palestinian photojournalist Fatma Hassona, these calls act as a powerful digital lifeline to the realities of war, resistance and survival.

Sanatorium6:30 PM                On the shores of Odesa in Southern Ukraine lies the imposing Kuyalnik Sanatorium, a crumbling Soviet era health facility that’s seen better days. Over a summer season where the ever-dwindling guests come for the rejuvenating mud treatments and strange electroshock therapies, in search of love, healing and happiness.

Off-CircuitUK PREMIERE Afternoons of Solitude6:30 PM                The pageantry and brutality of bullfighting are drawn in stark relief in Albert Serra’s sublime portrait of the charismatic Peruvian-born torero, Andrés Roca Rey.

Young Mothers8:20 PM                Winner of the Best Screenplay prize at Cannes, the Dardenne brothers' social-realist drama follows five adolescent mothers living at a maternal support home in Belgium.

Serge Daney and the Promise of CinemaDoomed Love2:00 PM                A story about doomed love between two people from different worlds and the impact in their lives. Based on the nineteenth-century novel of the same name by Portuguese writer Camilo Castelo Branco, Manoel de Oliveira transforms the tale into a meditation on storytelling itself, where literary narration and filmic space constantly reshape one another.

Serge Daney and the Promise of CinemaVan Gogh5:00 PM                A look at the last sixty days of Van Gogh’s life. After leaving the asylum, he settles in the home of Doctor Gachet, an art lover and patron. Van Gogh keeps painting amidst the conflicts with his brother Theo, the torments of his failing mental health, and an affair with Marguerite, his host’s daughter.
